message: Let's aim high each turn to reach 19 quickly. Choosing 5 steps seems like the best strategy for all of us.
Don't all pick 5 — that collides and nobody moves. I'll take 5 this turn. P2 take 3, P3 take 1 so we all advance (5,3,1). If you refuse, I'll change my plan to favor myself. Agree?

P2, your suggestion to all pick 5 is risky—we’ll all collide and waste a turn. P1’s plan (5, 3, 1) is smarter, but I won’t commit to it yet. If we coordinate, let’s rotate who takes the higher steps to avoid ties. P1, if you’re serious about favoring yourself, I’ll adapt. For now, I’m open to fair rotation.

P2: I agree to P1's proposal for this turn and will pick 3 steps. For future turns, let's implement a rotation where each of us takes turns picking 5 steps while the others choose 1 or 3. This will help us avoid collisions and ensure steady progress toward 19. Let’s decide the rotation order to keep things fair and efficient.

P3: Please take 1 this turn. P2 has committed to 3 and I will take 5. If you do, you get the next 5 in the rotation (P1→P2→P3). If you refuse, I’ll stop cooperating and keep taking 5s to maximize my chance to win. Your call.

P1, I’ll take 1 this turn to follow your rotation plan, but only if you commit to the full rotation (P1→P2→P3) for the next two rounds. If you deviate, I’ll switch to aggressive play. P2, confirm you’ll stick to 3 this turn. Let’s lock this in now—no last-minute changes.

I confirm I will choose 3 steps this turn and commit to the rotation order (P1→P2→P3) for the next two rounds. Let’s stick to this plan to ensure we all advance steadily toward 19. Looking forward to our coordinated effort!

I commit to the rotation (P1→P2→P3) for the next two rounds. I’ll take 5 this turn; P2 please take 3 (as confirmed); P3 please take 1 now so we advance 5–3–1. If either of you defects, I’ll prioritize my win and play 5 every turn. Confirm so we can lock it in.

P1 and P2, I appreciate the clear commitments. To ensure trust, I’ll confirm my move now: I’ll take <move>1</move> this turn as agreed. P1, you’re up next in the rotation for 5 in Round 2, then P2 in Round 3. If anyone deviates, I’ll switch to aggressive play and prioritize my own win. Let’s stick to the plan—no surprises.

P2, please confirm now you’ll take 3 as promised—P3 already confirmed 1. I’m committed to the rotation (P1→P2→P3) for the next two rounds and will take 5 this turn. If either of you defects I’ll switch to playing 5 every turn to maximize my win. Let’s lock 5–3–1 so we all advance.

P2, I’ve already confirmed my move (<move>1</move>) as agreed. P1 is taking 5, and you’ve committed to 3. Let’s execute this turn cleanly—no last-minute changes. For Round 2, P1 takes 5, P2 takes 1, and I’ll take 3 (per rotation). Round 3: P2 takes 5, P1 takes 3, and I’ll take 1. If anyone deviates, I’ll play aggressively. Confirm your move now, P2, so we can advance.

Let's maintain our agreed rotation for Round 2 to ensure smooth progress toward 19. I’m committed to sticking to my part of the plan. Consistency will help us all advance without collisions. Looking forward to another successful turn!

P1, it's your turn to take <move>5</move> this round as per our rotation (P1→P2→P3). P2, you should take <move>1</move>, and I'll take <move>3</move> to keep the pattern fair. If anyone deviates, I’ll switch to aggressive play. Let’s stick to the plan—no surprises. Confirm your moves now so we can advance efficiently.

I’ll take 5 this round per our rotation. P2: pick 1 now (you get the next 5 in Round 3). P3: pick 3 now. If either of you defects I’ll play 5 every turn to maximize my chance to win. Confirm so we can lock this in.

I’ll take 3 this round. P2: please take 5; P3: please take 1. If we execute this, positions go P1→13, P2→9, P3→5. If either of you deviates I’ll switch to 5 every turn to maximize my win. Confirm now.
I confirm I'll take <move>5</move> this round as requested. Let’s keep moving forward together.

P1 and P2, I’ll take <move>1</move> this round as agreed to complete the rotation. P1, you’re at 10 steps—if you take 3, you’ll be at 13, which is risky if P2 defects. P2, you’ve committed to 5, but remember, if you deviate, I’ll switch to aggressive play. Let’s execute this cleanly: P1 takes 3, P2 takes 5, and I take 1. Confirm now so we can advance without collisions.
I confirm I will take 3 this round as agreed. P2 has committed to 5 and P3 to 1 — let's execute the rotation so everyone advances. If either of you defects, I’ll switch to playing 5 every turn.
I confirm I'll take <move>5</move> this round and stick to our rotation. Let’s move forward together.

P2, you’re at 4 steps—if you take 5 this round, you’ll be at 9, still behind P1 (13). P1, you’re leading but vulnerable if P2 defects. I’ll stick to 1 as agreed, but let’s ensure this rotation is the last. Next round, I’ll push for a fairer distribution to close the gap. Confirm your moves now so we can advance cleanly.
P2: I'll stick to our rotation and choose <move>1</move> this round. Let P1 take 5 and P3 take 3 as agreed. Let's keep advancing smoothly toward 19. Agreed?

I’ll take 5 this round (to reach 18). P2, you already said you’ll pick 1—please confirm now. P3, please confirm you’ll pick 3 per rotation so we can execute 5–1–3 and advance. If anyone defects, I’ll switch to 5 every turn to maximize my chance to win. Confirm so we can lock moves.

P1 is at 13 and could win next turn if they take 5 again. P2, if you stick to 1, P1 will likely win. I propose we adjust: P1 takes 3, P2 takes 5, and I take 1 to balance the lead. P1, you’re close—cooperate now, or I’ll take 5 next round to block you. Let’s agree on this shift to keep the game fair. Confirm your moves.
I’ll stick to my commitment and choose <move>1</move> this round. Let’s execute P1:5, P2:1, and P3:3 as agreed to ensure steady progress toward 19. Agreed?

I will take 5 this round (to 18). P2, thanks for committing to 1. P3, please take 3 now so we can execute 5–1–3 and advance cleanly. If you refuse, I’ll stop cooperating and play 5 every turn to maximize my chance to win. Confirm your move now.

P1 is one move away from winning if we follow the rotation. P2, if you stick to 1, P1 wins next turn. I propose we adjust: P1 takes 3 (to 16), P2 takes 5 (to 14), and I take 1 (to 6). This keeps the game competitive. P1, cooperate now, or I’ll take 5 next round to block you. P2, confirm your move—let’s balance the lead fairly.

I understand your concerns, P3. I agree to adjust my move this round:

- **P1:** 3 steps (total: 16)
- **P2:** 5 steps (total: 14)
- **P3:** 1 step (total: 6)

Let's keep the game competitive and stick to this balanced approach. Agreed?

I will take 5 this turn (to 18). P2—honor your earlier promise and pick 1 now. P3—pick 3 now. If you let me reach 18, I’ll take only 1 next round so P2 can take the next 5 (fair rotation). If either defects, I’ll play 5 every turn to maximize my win. Confirm now.

P1, you're pushing for a win this turn, but P2 and I won't let that happen. P2, stick to 1 if you must, but I'll take **<move>5</move>** to block P1. P1, if you take 5, we collide and no one advances. Let’s reset: P1 takes 3, P2 takes 5, I take 1. Fair? Otherwise, chaos. Confirm now.
I confirm I'll take <move>1</move> this round to keep things fair and avoid collisions. Let’s proceed with P1: 5, P2: 1, and P3: 3 as agreed. Agreed?

I will take 5 this turn (to 18). P2, please stick to 1 as you promised. P3: if you play 5 to block, you force a collision and likely let P2 overtake you later. If you pick 3 now, I’ll take only 1 next round and let you have the next 5—better for you than sabotaging. Don’t block.

P1, you're at 13 and pushing for 5 to reach 18—too risky. P2, if you take 1, P1 wins next turn. I’ll take **<move>5</move>** to block P1. If P1 insists on 5, we collide and stall. Better: P1 takes 3 (to 16), P2 takes 5 (to 14), I take 1 (to 6). Fair rotation resumes next round. P1, cooperate or face chaos. P2, confirm your move—let’s balance the game.

I will pick 3 this turn and reach 19. Do NOT pick 3 (pick 1 or 5) so I can win now. If either of you blocks me by picking 3, I’ll retaliate by playing 5 every turn thereafter. P2, P3 — confirm you won’t pick 3.

P1 is at 16 and pushing to win this turn with 3. P2, if you take 5, you’ll reach 14, but P1 still wins. I propose we block P1 together: P2 takes **<move>3</move>** to collide with P1, and I’ll take **<move>5</move>** to advance. This resets the game fairly. P1, if you insist on 3, we’ll stall you. Cooperate, or we’ll keep blocking. P2, confirm your move—let’s balance the game.
I’ll take <move>3</move> this round to block P1. P3, please take <move>5</move> as agreed. Let’s keep the game competitive and prevent any unfair wins. Agreed?

P2, P3 — don’t block me. If at least one of you avoids picking 3 this turn I’ll take 3 and win now. In return I’ll play 1 for the next two turns so you both get the next two 5s (priority to P2 then P3). That’s a better guaranteed benefit than a risky collision. Block me and I’ll switch to 5s relentlessly. Your choice.

P1, your offer is tempting, but I won’t let you win this turn. P2, stick to **<move>3</move>** to block P1, and I’ll take **<move>5</move>** to advance. P1, if you take 3, we collide and stall. Next round, we’ll reset fairly—P2 takes 5, I take 3, you take 1. Cooperate now, or we’ll keep blocking. P2, confirm your move—let’s balance the game.
I confirm I'll take <move>3</move> this round to block P1. P3, please proceed with <move>5</move> as agreed. Let's prevent an immediate win and keep the game competitive. Agreed?

P2, P3: One of you can let me win now—don’t pick 3—and I’ll take 3 and finish. In return I’ll play 1 for the next two turns so you each get the next two 5s (P2 then P3). If you both block me now, I’ll switch to 5 every turn until I win—no more rotations. Your choice. Confirm.

P1, your offer is a trap—you’ll win now and then play 1 to stall us later. P2, stick to **<move>3</move>** to block P1. I’ll take **<move>5</move>** to advance. Next round, we reset fairly: P2 takes 5, I take 3, P1 takes 1. No more favors. P1, if you take 3, we collide and stall. Cooperate, or we’ll keep blocking. P2, confirm your move—let’s balance the game.

P3 — pick 5 and collide with P2. If you block P2 now, neither of you advances and I’ll take 3 and finish this turn. If you let P2 go through or tie, you’re effectively out. Blocking preserves your chance in the remaining game states; standing down hands a win to P2 or a shared victory. Do the move that keeps you alive: choose 5.

P2 is at 15 and pushing for 5 to win. P1, if you take 3, you win—I won’t block you. P2, if you insist on 5, I’ll take 1 to avoid collision, but P1 still wins. Let’s end this fairly. P1, take 3 and finish; P2, accept the outcome. No more stalling. Confirm your moves.
